page.title: 19RESTORATION IN WILLINGDON
page.content: Crumbling cement facing has been removed from a house at the Wish Hill end of Old Barn Close to reveal an attractive flint wall. On the same property a boundary wall of flint has been built from the house to a garage which has been erected in its garden. The high flint wall bounding "Five Gables" at the junction of Church Street and Wish Hill has been largely rebuilt. Two large Georgian houses have been extensively restored, one at the Wish Hill end of Upper King's Drive, the other close by, facing the Post Office. These are recent renovations and probably indicate that wealthier people have been attracted to Upper Willingdon. In any case, it is evident there is a strong desire amongst the residents to conserve and improve the area.
